comment.author: 45504413@N08
comment._content: This Brockton, Mass! My hometown! One of the northern states that may get very cold in the winter, BUT atleast we know how to deal with it! I'm in Nashville, Tennessee where, IF they get 2"-3" of snow, they start shutting down schools etc. They don't put any salt on the roads nor do I see many plows. In one winter season, I saw TWO plows and they weren't doing their job...the plows themselves weren't even touching the road! "IF" Nashville were to get the kind of snow like we get up north, they'd be up the creek without a paddle!!!

comment.author: 51966721@N03
comment._content: Was this Flagg's Pond, before it was reduced to a puddle to build the "new" high school in the late '60s?  I was too young, about 5, when they did that but used to hang out around the reduced pond a lot w/ my buddies.  We heard a lot about how big it used to be.  It could also be a pond in Fields Park, except I think there are too many houses near the edge. Flagg's Pond had houses nearby, within sight.  Anybody remember for sure?
